pageContext.claim: “Our miners have been mistreated, and they're not being mistreated any more. We're doing tremendous business.”
pageContext.analysis: According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, only 900 jobs have been created in the coal industry since Trump became president — an increase of 2 percent. Administration officials often misleadingly refer to “mining” jobs, which mostly consist of jobs in the oil sector, which has rebounded from a price slump that has little to do with administration policies.
